SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.field

Class PositionManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.field.PositionManager
public class PositionManager extends Object
Manages the positioning of cards on the field in the game.

This class is responsible for keeping track of the positions of cards on the field, determining which positions are available for placing new cards, and handling the placement of new cards on the field.

It maintains a set of available positions where new cards can be placed, a set of closed positions where no new cards can be placed, and a map that associates each positioned card with its position on the field.

It also keeps track of the last card that was placed on the field, which can be useful for undoing the last move or for other game mechanics that depend on the order of card placement.

  • Constructor Details

    • PositionManager

      public PositionManager()
      Constructor for the PositionManager class.

      This constructor initializes the availablePositions set with a single position at (0,0), the closedPositions set as an empty set, and the cardsPositioned map as an empty map. It also sets the lastPlacedCard to null.

      The initial capacity for the availablePositions and closedPositions sets is 32, and for the cardsPositioned map is 64. These values are chosen as a performance optimization to reduce the need for resizing the collections as cards are placed on the field.

  • Method Details

    • getMovementOfPositions

      public static Position getMovementOfPositions (@NotNull @NotNull Position currentPosition, @NotNull @NotNull List<Corner> corners)
      Calculates the final position after a series of movements from a given position.

      This method takes a Position object representing the current position and a List of Corner objects representing the directions of the movements. It applies each movement in the list to the current position in order, and returns the final position after all movements have been applied.

      If the list of movements is empty, this method returns the current position unchanged.

      Parameters:
      currentPosition - The current position.
      corners - The list of movements to apply.
      Returns:
      The final position after applying all movements.

    • getPositionIn

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull Position getPositionIn (@NotNull @NotNull Position position, @NotNull @NotNull Corner corner)
      Calculates the new position based on the current position and the direction of movement.

      This method takes a Position object representing the current position and a Corner object representing the direction of the movement. It calculates the new position after applying the movement to the current position and returns the new position.

      The movement is applied by changing the x and y coordinates of the current position based on the specified direction. For example, if the direction is TOP_RX, the x and y coordinates are both increased by 1.

      Parameters:
      position - The current position.
      corner - The direction of the movement.
      Returns:
      The new position after applying the movement.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the state of the PositionManager.

      This method clears all the positions stored in the availablePositions, closedPositions, and cardsPositioned collections. It then adds a single position at (0,0) to the availablePositions set, effectively resetting the state of the PositionManager to its initial state.

    • placeCard

      @NotNull public @NotNull List<Item> placeCard (@NotNull @NotNull FieldCard card, @NotNull @NotNull Position position, boolean isRetro) throws IllegalCardPlacingException
      Places a card on the field at a specified position.

      This method takes a FieldCard object representing the card to be placed, a Position object representing the position where the card should be placed, and a boolean indicating whether the card is placed in retro mode.

      It first checks if the specified position is available for placing the card. If the position is available, it removes the position from the availablePositions set and creates a new CardContainer object of the FieldCard to the cardsPositioned map, associating the card with the specified position.

      It then updates the availablePositions and closedPositions sets based on the availability of the corners of the new card. Positions adjacent to an available corner of the new card are added to the availablePositions set, and positions adjacent to a closed corner of the new card are added to the closedPositions set.

      Finally, it sets the lastPlacedCard to the new card and returns a list of Item objects representing the items that are covered by the new card.

      If the specified position is not available for placing the card, this method throws an IllegalCardPlacingException.

      Parameters:
      card - The card to be placed.
      position - The position where the card should be placed.
      isRetro - Indicates whether the card is placed in retro mode.
      Returns:
      A list of items that are covered by the new card.
      Throws:
      IllegalCardPlacingException - If the specified position is not available for placing the card.

    • getCornerFromPositions

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Optional<Corner> getCornerFromPositions (@NotNull @NotNull Position posToCheck, @NotNull @NotNull Position posTarget)
      Determines the corner from the positions of two adjacent cells.

      This method takes two Position objects representing the positions of two adjacent cells on the field. It calculates the difference in the x and y coordinates of the two positions to determine the direction from the first position to the second position. It then returns an Optional containing the Corner corresponding to this direction.

      If the two positions are not adjacent or if they are diagonally adjacent, this method returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      posToCheck - The position of the first cell.
      posTarget - The position of the second cell.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the Corner corresponding to the direction from the first position to the second position, or an empty Optional if the two positions are not adjacent or if they are diagonally adjacent.

    • getAvailablePositions

      public Set<Position> getAvailablePositions()
      Retrieves a copy of the set of available positions.

      This method returns a copy of the availablePositions set, which represents all the positions on the field where a new card can be placed. The returned set is a copy, so changes to the returned set will not affect the availablePositions set in the PositionManager.

      Returns:
      A copy of the set of available positions.

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable (@NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      Checks if a given position is available for placing a card.

      This method takes a Position object representing the position to check. It returns a boolean indicating whether the position is available for placing a card. A position is considered available if it is not occupied by a card and if it is not adjacent to a closed corner of a card.

      Parameters:
      position - The position to check.
      Returns:
      True if the position is available for placing a card, false otherwise.

    • containsCard

      public boolean containsCard (@NotNull @NotNull FieldCard card)
      Checks if a given card is already placed on the field.

      This method takes a FieldCard object representing the card to check. It returns a boolean indicating whether the card is already placed on the field. The check is performed by comparing the given card with each card in the cardsPositioned map.

      Parameters:
      card - The card to check.
      Returns:
      True if the card is already placed on the field, false otherwise.

    • getCardsPositioned

      public Map<Position,CardContainer> getCardsPositioned()
      Retrieves a copy of the map of positioned cards.

      This method returns a copy of the cardsPositioned map, which associates each positioned card with its position on the field. The returned map is a copy, so changes to the returned map will not affect the cardsPositioned map in the PositionManager.

      Returns:
      A copy of the map of positioned cards.

    • save

      @NotNull public @NotNull PositionManagerMemento save()
      Used to save the current state of the PositionManager in a memento.
      Returns:
      the memento with the current state of the PositionManager

    • load

      public void load (@NotNull @NotNull PositionManagerMemento memento)
      Used to reload an old status of the PositionManager from a memento.
      Parameters:
      memento - the memento to reload
